application_type_full: Tree works: Trees in conservation areas/subject to TPOs
decision_conditions: Removal of deadwood and construction of root barrier.

The removal of deadwood is not covered by the TPO process so there is no requirement to gain permission to remove this, but this is covered as a notification that work is intended to remove this deadwood from the three trees T1 Cedar T4 Pinus and T51 Cedar tree.
There are no specifications regarding the construction of a root barrier.
The applicant is advised that if you wish to carry out further works to the above trees you will need to obtain our further consent.
It is recommended that these three trees can be pruned as follows;
T1- Cedar-  (Next to 4 Freeman Way T1 - TPO 1/99) can be overall crown reduced by 1m, from the tip to an inter-nodal branch break to leave the tree balanced.
T2- Pinus-  (Next to 5 Freeman way T4 - TPO 1/99) can be overall crown reduced by 1m,  from the tip to an inter-nodal branch break to leave the tree balanced.
T3- Cedar (In the rear Garden) identified as T51 of Havering's TPO 19/72 can be overall crown reduced by 1.5m,  from the tip to an inter-nodal branch break to leave the tree balanced.
The work for which consent is granted shall be carried out to the standards detailed in British Standard Document BS 3998:2010.
Reason:
To ensure that the work is carried out in accordance with good arboricultural practice.
The work for which consent is granted shall be carried out as an overall reduction, so that the tree's crown remains balanced.
Reason:
To ensure that the tree's stability is maintained and in the interests of public amenity.
The work for which consent is granted shall be carried out within 2 years from the date of this consent.
Reason:
To prevent the accumulation of consents.

It is suggested that you engage the services of a qualified and fully insured tree surgeon to carry out the above work on your behalf (you should ask to see the contractor's insurance certificate and make sure that it is up to date).
Root barrier
The authority will require, a subsequent application with detailed specifications regarding the installation of a root barrier  for T2- Pinus-  (Next to 5 Freeman way T4 - TPO 1/99)
description:
T1- Cedar- Crown Reduction and removal of Dead branches
T2-Pinus- Crown Reduction; Removal of Dead branches + Construction of ROOT Barrier which is damaging the drive way
T3- Cedar- Crown Reduction and Removal of Dead branches
